title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
More health experts, businesspeople and government officials are questioning how long people infected with Covid-19 should quarantine if they are vaccinated and no longer testing positive.

The FDA cleared use of a Covid-19 pill from Merck and partner Ridgeback for adults at high risk of severe disease shortly after they develop mild to moderate symptoms.

---

The U.S. and Russia moved closer to convening talks over tensions surrounding Ukraine, though American officials warned that Moscow is continuing to build up forces near the Ukraine border.

---

Saudi Arabia has imported sensitive missile technology from the Chinese military and is manufacturing its own ballistic missiles, according to Saudi advisers and officials familiar with U.S. intelligence.

---

Kimberly Potter, the former Brooklyn Center, Minn., police officer who fatally shot Daunte Wright during a traffic stop in April, was found guilty of manslaughter.

---

Trump asked the Supreme Court to block the House panel investigating the Jan. 6 assault on the Capitol from accessing presidential records from his time in office.

---

New Jersey officials agreed to pay about $53 million to families of state-run veterans-home residents to settle claims over facility managers' pandemic response.
